We thank Patrick Taylor and two other anonymous reviewers for their constructive
comments. We acknowledge the CMIP5 modeling groups, the Program for Climate
Model Diagnosis and Intercomparison, and the WCRP
Modelling for their efforts in making available the WCRP CMIP multi-model datasets
used here. This study is partly supported by the Chinese Academy of Science Strategic
Priority Research Program (Grant XDA 19070403). D.L. is also supported by the
National Science Foundation of China (Grant #41430533). A.D. is supported by the
National Science Foundation (AGS-1353740 and OISE-1743738), the U.S. Department of
ce of Science (DE-SC0012602), and the U.S. National Oceanic and Atmo-
spheric Administration (NA15OAR4310086). M.S. is supported by the National Key
R&D Program of China (2018YFA0605901). J.L. is supported by the National Oceanic
A.D. designed the study, performed all the calculations and CESM1 simulations, made all
gures except Figure 9, which was made by Jiao Chen, and wrote the paper. D.L.
participated in constructive discussions and helped improve the paper. M.S. helped
ed the codes for the CESM1 experiments. J.L. contributed to the design of the
The authors declare no competing interests.
information is available online at http://npg.nature.com/
